entries: Dexterity is your spellcasting ability for casting cantrips. Your finesse in its casting determines the spells potency. You use your Dexterity whenever a Cantrip refers to your Cantrip casting ability. You also use your Dexterity modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard Cantrip you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

classFeature.name: Power Surge
entries: At the 3rd Level, You gain the ability to Convert spell slots into vigour slots. You can use a bonus action to spend a spell slot and gain a number of vigour slots equal to the spell slot's level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Augments
entries: At the 5th Level, You've learnt to channel the vigour within to perform various feats. When entering spelldance you can choose to spend some vigour slots to apply one augment to your spelldance. You learn to use two at this level and learn one more at 9th and 15th level.
When reaching a level in this class that grants a Feat or an ASI. you can choose to swap one of the Augments for another.

entries.name: Mummer's Dance
entries: The Flickwrist spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your wizard spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest. For example, if you know the 1st-level spell shield and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast shield using either slot.

entries.name: Zephyr's Dance
entries: When you enter spelldance you can use a bonus action and any number of vigour slots to gain movement equal to 5 ft. per slot. This movement provokes no opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Dance of Agony
entries: You can spend 3 vigour slots on to enhance Cantrips cast within this spelldance. Any saving throw incurred by the Cantrip is made at disadvantage.

entries.name: Mollifying Dance
entries: You can spend a vigour slot to impose a 1d4 penalty to creatures when making a saving throw for a Cantrip cast in the spell dance.

entries.name: Dance of Crashing Waves
entries: You can spend a number of vigour slots on this dance. if a large or smaller creature fails a saving throw for one Cantrip cast in the spell dance it is pushed number of feet away or closer equal to 5 times the vigour slots used

entries.name: Biding Dance
entries: You can spend a vigour slot on this dance. The next spelldance you enter before the end of your next turn will grant you 2 additional vigour slots. This augment cannot be then used on that spelldance.

entries.name: Dance of the Spiral
entries: You can spend a vigour slot to generate a strong dust devil from you till the beginning of your next turn. A spherical area of 10 ft. radius around you is difficult terrain for creatures besides you.

entries.name: Drunkard's Dance
entries: You can spend a vigour slot to gain +2 to your AC till the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Dance of the Coiled Serpent
entries: You can spend a vigour slot to extend your spelldance till the beginning of your next turn. While in this state you can cast Cantrips at any creature you can see that makes an attack roll without using your reaction provided it is in range of the Cantrip.

entries.name: Dance of Torn Mind
entries: You may spend no vigour slots to enter this dance. While this dance is in effect, you may cast two Cantrips that require concentration and hold concentration on both of them. Though for as long as you hold concentration on both of them, your choreurgic repletion suffers by 1 vigour slot.

entries.name: Vengeful Dance
entries: You may spend 2 vigour slots to enter a retaliatory state. Till the beginning of your next turn, Creatures that make an attack targeting you are marked till the end of your next turn. The first Cantrip cast at each of them will impose disadvantage for its saving throw.

classFeature.name: Style Feature
entries: At the 6th Level, You gain a feature granted by your Choreurgic Style.

classFeature.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: At the 7th Level, If you are affected by a spell that isn't targeting you, you can use your reaction to move 10 ft before it hits potentially avoiding damage. Additionally, While wearing light or no armour you gain 10 ft. of movement.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM uses the optional Feats, you can instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: At the 9th level, your damaging Cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your Cantrip, the creature takes half the Cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the Cantrip.
Additionally, For the purposes of overcoming resistances, empowered cantrips count as a spell of as many levels as vigour slots used to cast it.

classFeature.name: Style Feature
entries: At 7th Level, If you are affected by a spell that isn't targeting you, you can use your reaction to move 10 ft before it hits potentially avoiding damage.

classFeature.name: Perpetual Motion
entries: At the 11th Level, You can get up from being prone with only 5 feet of movement. Additionally difficult terrain does not hinder your movement.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM uses the optional Feats, you can instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Elastic body
entries: At the 13th, You have advantage on all saving throws and checks to avoid or escape an effect that causes you to be grappled or restrained.

classFeature.name: Style Feature
entries: At the 14th Level, You gain a feature granted by your Choreurgic Style.

classFeature.name: Minor Magic Resistance
entries: At the 15th Level, Coming to be quite familiar with Lesser Magics you've developed choreurgic counter measures against them. You have Advantage on saving throws against Cantrips and can spend a reaction and some vigour slots to gain advantage on a saving throw against spells up to the 3rd level. you must spend an amount equal to the spells level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM uses the optional Feats, you can instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Mastery
entries: At the 17th Level, You gain access to all Cantrips that can be learnt by a wizard.

classFeature.name: Esoteric techniques
entries: At the 18th Level, Great effort and experimentation has allowed you to simplify leveled spells. Pick two level 1 spells requiring an action to cast that you know. They are now Cantrips for you and won't count towards spells known.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM uses the optional Feats, you can instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Opus Vitae
entries: You've toiled away your entire life to reach here. What you have been working towards represents one of these features you shall receive. At the 20th Level you may choose one of the following features:-

entries.name: Magisterium Corporum
entries: Your Choreurgic repletion increases by two.

entries.name: Magnum Opus
entries: Choose a 3rd level spell that you know. This spell becomes your Magnum Opus. You may cast this spell as a Cantrip during spelldance by expending 3 vigour slots a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier per day.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Awakened Mind
entries: Old Livian tales speak of strangely garbed men who broke upon the shores of Yesvaris on strange boats from a sea that surrounds no land. They bore no blade nor bow, spoke no tongue that one could understand, bearing no message nor gift for any lord, instead they were content to merely wander the earth.

Little was spoken yet some could detect some deep disappointment. They sold their ships and settled into a refuge atop Mt. Songshan. There they would live mostly in isolation, far from the squabbling tribes below for a few centuries.

Only during the invasions of Gulbrodr, the Reaver King did they swear fealty to Seauntrenu the Strange under the agreement that he or anyone else may seek tutelage from the monastery if their devotion was deemed enough.

A few of the acolytes there would learn of a way to seemingly poke and prod their sight through to a second world held within the future. Though some believe it demeaning to utilize such a blessing for combat, rogue schools doing just that would eventually rise, with the original purpose lost to time.
Heretical though it may been to some, it proved to be a very effective method of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Premonition
entries: As a bonus action, you slip into one of two lucid states where you perceive glimpses into the near future:-

entries.name: Vulpine
entries: As part of the bonus action and at the start of each of your turns while you are in the state, make a Premonition check (a DC 15 Wisdom check). On a success, roll a Premonition die which is a d20 and keep it with it's result. Whenever a feature calls for spending a Premonition die, you must possess and spend at least one ki point to use it.
Whenever you or a creature you see within 10 ft. makes an attack roll or a saving throw you may replace the roll with the Premonition die's roll, spending it.

Any Premonition die gained, lasts only till the start of your next turn, unless you spend a ki point then. If you do, you forgo making the Premonition check for that turn and keep the Premonition die from the previous turn.
This state lasts for a minute, after which any Premonition die possessed are discarded.

entries.name: Cervine
entries: For this turn and for the next 10 minutes, you gain advantage on all ability checks.
Once you enter any of these states, you must take a long rest to regain use of it.

entries.name: Roll20 Macro
entries: A nifty macro for Premonition checks in Roll20. In your Roll20 character sheet look for the 'Attributes & Abilities' tab. Then create an ability called something like 'Premonition check' and in the larger text field paste this bit of code
&{template:default}{{name=Premonition Check}}{{ [[ {1d20+@{<Character name>|wisdom_mod}}>[[15]] ]] }}
Then replace '<Character name>' with the case sensitive name on the sheet (remove the < & >). click the tick mark, then check 'Show in Macro Bar'.

subclassFeature.name: Pass the time
entries: As part of your rigorous training, you would learn to pick up many games of luck or skill. In each bout, acolytes would attempt to utilize their unnatural foresight against each other in what was essentially a contest to peer further into the future than their opponent.
Choose a {@item Gaming Set}. You become proficient with it and any checks made with Gaming Sets are made with advanatage.

subclassFeature.name: Peel back the Veil
entries: You achieve the first step towards understanding the nature of this world, utilizing your learnings as abilities.
Wou may spend two ki points to cast {@spell Augury}, {@spell Locate Object}, {@spell Find Traps} or {@spell Fortune's Favor|EGW} (without the spells material components).
Additionally, When you have no uses of Premonition, you can use a number of ki points equal to your proficiency bonus at the end of a short rest to regain use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Living ahead of the moment
entries: At the 11th level, You have spent such time peering across the temporal realm that you have mastered it's interference with your reality. You gain the following benefits:-

items: When you make a Premonition check or when rolling for your Premonition die, you may use a bonus action and ki point to reroll the d20.
You may now attempt to replace the rolls of creatures you can see with Premonition die's within 20 ft. of you, instead of 10 ft..
When you roll a d20 on your Premonition die, you may immediately spend it to get advantage on all attacks and saving throws for this turn.

subclassFeature.name: A Body one with the Future
entries: At the 17th level, The barriers to the temporal realm now remain a mere curtain for your mind and can even twist the threads of fate to some extent. You gain the follwoing features

subclassFeature.name: Predictive Impulse
entries: Whenever you use the attack action you may spend a Premonition die to make an additional attack using the result on it as the roll. Additionally, when you dodge an attack using a Premonition die, the next attack made against you is made with disadvantage till the state ends.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Fate
entries: Once per long rest, when you roll your Premonition die, you may instead choose a number from 5-15 and keep the Premonition die with that number.

subclassFeature.name: The Croupier
entries: Tales and rumours occasionally spill from the taverns of men who appear to be perhaps too charming, a tad more deft or quite a bit smooth in the way they operate. Perhaps they've played the violin too well for his time or they've caught the hearts of one too many an admirer or, most commonly, they find themselves with too many winning hands. So tales and rumors become myth of men succumbing to the dealings of an opportunistic power and for once, they're right.

Entities of many vareity take the form of The Croupier when they come to strike a wager with their beneficiaries, usually appealing to their greed or their desire for more charm or even simply a want for the skill they offer. These beings can be tricksters, agents of chaos, enjoyers of the arts, observers of luck or even sheerly malignant. They take the form of a simple dealer luring their victims with bets eventually culminating in a stacked contract. Since after all:-
The house always wins.

subclassFeature.name: "Is this your card?"
entries: At 1st level when you choose this pact, your patron bestows his conduit for your Warlock spells; The Eldtritch Deck. You can spend 1 hour in ritual to summon the deck in your hand or convert an appropriate arcane focus to one. you may only have one at a time and attempting to create another will result the previous deck disappearing, leaving an arcane focus behind if it was used.

The deck counts as an arcane focus and appears as a pack of cards to a game of your choosing. It appears non-magical to divination magic and when drawn from the pack, produces the exact cards for whichever game is being played upto a total of 400 cards. Any cards outside the pack disappear after 24 hours. You may also choose to know the exact position and faces of cards in the deck.

You become proficient with {@filter gaming sets|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=gaming set} and learn the {@spell prestidigitation} spell. When you use it, you can conceal the verbal and somatic components of the spell as ordinary conversation and card handling.

entries.name: Eldritch Cards(Optional)
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast} with the Eldritch Deck, instead of beams you can choose to give them the appearance of cards produced from your deck.

subclassFeature.name: Croupier's Pact Spells
entries: The Croupier lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Cardistry
entries: Your patron grants you the house edge; A set of abilities for you to choose from known as 'Tricks'. You know of one of your choice from the table below when you get this feature and can know as many as the number of warlock spell slots you possess, learning a new one when you gain another slot.

When you use a Trick, you must spend a warlock spell slot for the spellcasting involved abd you may not use the same Trick again until you finish a short or a long rest. You cannot use multiple tricks on the same spell. You may replace a Trick you know for another when you gain a level in this class.

entries.caption: Cardistry
rows: You may use this trick when you cast a spell to disappear in a cloud and turn {@condition invisible} until the beginning of your next turn.
When a creature targets you with a attack roll or a spell, you may use this Trick and cast a spell with the casting time of an action and targeting only that creature if within range of the spell.
When you use the {@action cast a spell} action, you may use this Trick by throwing a card at a point within 30 feet of you. The spell is then cast as though you were standing at that point.

You can use this Trick by using an action to store a spell of a casting time of an Action, bonus action or reaction spending a warlock spell slot in the process. A person wielding this card may then use the corresponing action to cast the spell with your save DC, spell attack bonus and spellcasting ability, spending the card in the proccess.
You can use this Trick by casting a spell with the casting time of an action as a bonus action.

When you cast a spell you can use this Trick to bedazzle creatures around you with your stage magic. 3 creatures of your choice 60 feet away from you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or all become {@condition charmed} by you or all {@condition blinded} (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

When you cast a spell that targets a single creature, you can use this Trick to target a second. If the spell includes an attack roll or a saving throw, both are subject to it. After seeing the results, you may pick one of them and they take the full effect of the spell.
You can use this Trick to cast a spell wihtout its somatic and verbal components.

At the start of your turn you may choose to use this Trick by rolling {@roll 2d8|2 d8s}, rerolling any repeats then picking one. Until the start of your next turn, you are able to use the corresponding Trick in the table once.

subclassFeature.name: Sharp Instincts
entries: At the 6th level, your Senses and Skills as a gambler becomed honed. Pick one of the streams from below when you get this feature. You receive its benefits.

items: {@b Showmanship:} You gain proficiency in Charisma(Performance) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Deceit:} You gain proficiency in Charisma(Performance) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Finesse:} You gain proficiency in Dexterity(Sleight-of-Hand) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Flair:} Your proficiency bonus is doubled when making checks with Gaming Sets.
{@b Wariness:} You gain proficiency in Wisdom(Insight) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Mistrust:} You get a hidden +5 bonus to checks to determine an illusion that your DM applies.

entries: If you are already proficient in a skill that you picked a stream for, you may pick another from the Warlock class skills.

subclassFeature.name: Lady Luck's Kiss
entries: You know the {@spell fortune's favor|egw} spell and can cast it once at its lowest level without a material component. When cast this way, the duration lasts for 8 hours instead. You have it always prepared and it doesn't count towards your spells known limit.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Card
entries: At the 10th level, your patron hides a few tricks up your sleeve.
Once per long rest, you may cast a warlock spell of a slot that is available that you haven't prepared.

You also gain a wild card in the form of an additional special warlock spell slot. When casting with the wild card, you may use any applicable Trick you know in conjuction with it without spending a use of the Trick. You regain use of it after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The House Always Wins
entries: At the 14th level, your patron grants you his greatest boon, an unstable connection to the weave. You gain possession of 2 special dice in the form of a d4 and a d6, gaining a d8 as well at the 15th level in this class.

Whenever you spend a warlock spell slot, you may roll a d4. If casting from the 6th or 7th level Mystic Arcanum, roll a d6 or a d8 if casting from the 8th or 9th level Mystic Arcanum. If any of these dice rolls roll their maximum, you regain the spell slot or use of the Mystic Arcanum.
Once regained, that die cannot be used until a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Poise
entries: Within the spelldance it is prefered by most choreurgists to be wielding nothing as any unnecessary weight hinders the ability to motion fast and precisely. Practitioners of the School of Poise learn to integrate weapons into their spelldance.
They Allow their body to meld with the weapon by adapting to their weapon's heft and wieldiness. If they manage to integrate it into their body, perhaps they may even cast spells through them.

subclassFeature.name: Poise Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Poise Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Balance Training
entries: You gain proficiency with a weapon that possesses the finesse property of your choice.

You must spend time before a long rest training with a weapon with the finesse property that you are proficient in, to get used to its weight and form after which it becomes your Poise weapon. Any such weapon of similar make can then be used as your poise weapon.
Your poise weapon becomes an arcane focus for you. When you cast spells, you can cast them through this weapon.
You may know only one poise weapon as it takes time adjusting to another. While wielding Poise weapons and no other weapons nor shields, you gain all of this subclasses features.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Fencer's Dance
entries: Augment. You can spend one vigour slot when entering spelldance to grant yourself additional reach of 5 ft. and extend the range of Cantrips with a range of Self(5 feet) to the reach of your weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Insightful Strike
entries: Once per turn, When you successfully land a melee attack on a creature, you create an opening for yourself. The creature will suffer a disadvantage on a saving throw for the next Cantrip you cast at that creature till the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Clairvoyant Strike
entries: Enchances True Strike. When you cast true strike, it's benefits are instead applied to the next weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Forte
entries: Cantrips on their own are too simple a spell to reach any height of power. Followers of the school of Forte recognize a method of casting them deemed unorthodox and unstable. They tap into an inner chaos present within their spelldance and the spells they cast, Sacrificing safety and certainty to unlock it's potential to wreak untold amounts of destruction.

subclassFeature.name: Forte Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Forte Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Interference
entries: If you cast a damaging Cantrip which targets a single creature and it fails its saving throw, The damage roll it receives may increase the damage. If any number is repeated in the damage roll, you must add it again to the total damage.
This feature must be used after rerolling any damage dice

subclassFeature.name: Overloaded
entries: Your Choreurgic Capacity increases by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Dance of Synchronicity
entries: Augment. You can spend one vigour slot when you enter this dance to be able to reroll one damage of each Cantrip cast within the spelldance.

subclassFeature.name: Constructive Interference
entries: Enhances interference. When two of the damage dice roll the same even number, you can target a second creature with the same Cantrip within its range.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Interference
entries: Enhances interference. For every repeated odd number that appears, the radius of a spherical area of effect grows by 10 ft. centered at the target. Every creature in that area receives half the total damage of the corresponding damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Modulation
entries: When you use the Dance of Synchronicity augment, you can now reroll 2 damage dice per Cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Fervour
entries: In the arduous course of memorizing and repetition, you've taken a keen interest in the elemental nature of the spells you cast and the effects of your innate zeal in fueling them. In this journey, you gain greater insight into the elements, their reactions to the creatures they affect and perhaps more importantly, ways to protect against them.

subclassFeature.name: Fervour Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Fervour Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Analysis
entries: Once per turn, when a creature you can see is affected by a Cantrip you cast, you can check To see if the creature was resistant, immune or vulnerable to the damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Prismatic Guard
entries: If you cast a Cantrip that deals damage, you can choose to become resistant to its damage type till the start of your next turn. You can invoke this resistance a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier before each long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dance of Shattered Light
entries: Augment. You can spend one vigour slot to change the damage type of any Cantrips cast within the spelldance.

subclassFeature.name: Chromatic Cascade
entries: For each Cantrip you cast previously within the spelldance that dealt a different damage type, you deal an additional point of damage of the corresponding type when casting a Cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Prismatic Ward
entries: As a bonus action you can pick two willing creatures within 30ft of you. They will receive the benefit of your Prismatic Guard while they are in range.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Rigour
entries: There's more to casting than shaking a hand and uttering some words. Perhaps those that follow the school of Rigour understand this more than most. They view Choreurgy and minor magics as a science to be thoroughly studied and grasped. Cantrips and the arcane motion are equations on a parchment that need to be broken down and rebuilt constantly to achieve the most efficiency. With enough experimentation they hope to engineer movements so complex that it would be as if you were dancing with two bodies.

subclassFeature.name: Rigour Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Rigour Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip Efficiency
entries: You've created a method to make the spelldance itself more efficient. You can add your intelligence modifier to the total Damage roll of your Cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Torrential Dance
entries: Augment. You can spend two vigour slots to modify your Cantrips, enabling them to disrupt your opponents ability to resist the effects of your Cantrips. When a creature fails a saving throw of a Cantrip cast in this spelldance, it becomes debilitated till the end of your next turn. While this way, it has disadvantage against the debilitating saving throw for Cantrips you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Vigorous Transmutation
entries: Your study into the nature of surge conversion has yielded a more efficient method of transmuting vigour slots. When you use the power surge feature to convert spell slots, you get one additional vigour slot.

subclassFeature.name: Metachoreurgy
entries: You've learnt to tap into a 'Second Body'. Controlling it allows you to push the intricacy of your spelldance to new frontiers. When you enter Spelldance, you can apply two augments at the same time.
Additionally, if you choose to only use one augment, Cantrips you cast within the spelldance do not require a somatic component.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Grace
entries: Practitioners of the style of grace are able to channel their dance into a sight of placidity, easing the stressed and benumbing the hurt. Due to their limited arcane capability they do not make for effective healers but through their soothing dance they are capable of numbing pain and easing suffering, allowing those under their care to fight just that little bit longer or at the very least, carry the wounded to safety.

subclassFeature.name: Grace Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Grace Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Lesser Healer
entries: You gain proficiency with the herbalism kit. If you are already proficient in it you may choose a tool proficiency from the possible Flickwrist's tool proficiencies.

subclassFeature.name: First Response
entries: Modifies Spare the Dying. When you cast Spare the Dying on a dying creature you may revive it with 1 hit point. However for each time it has been revived this way since it's last long rest, it will automatically fail that many death saves when they begin dying again.

subclassFeature.name: Preserver's Dance
entries: Augment. You may spend one vigour slot when entering spell dance to give your Cantrips a soothing byproduct. When you cast a Cantrip during this dance, roll a number of d6s equal to the vigour slots used. You may grant a creature of your choice within the Cantrip's range the resulting total as temporary hitpoints. You may use this dance a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. When you reach the 10th and 14th level the d6s become d8s and d10s respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Placating Presence
entries: When making a Charisma(Persuasion) or a Charisma(Deception) check you can add your Wisdom Modifier to it.

subclassFeature.name: Lulling Balm
entries: If you have 4 vigour slots, as an action, you may initiate a hypnotic performance. 6 Creatures of your choice that can see you and that you can see must make Wisdom Saving Throws against your Cantrip Save DC. On a failure, they are then Blinded or Charmed. If Charmed, they move at half speed and cannot take any actions that harm other creatures. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns.

subclassFeature.name: Swansong
entries: When using the First Response feature, You are able to tap into an energy reserve innate within the creature. The creature being revived can expend upto half of his remaining hit dice (rounded up) to heal itself.

subclassFeature.name: Saboteur
entries: When the Livian 12th Engineer corps trained their first Saboteurs, they expected them to infiltrate enemy lines in disguise and wreak havoc in their most crucial moments. Not only did they succeed in that front, their purpose has expanded in many directions since then. Finding use even in the front lines where they would wield a mechanism acting as a third arm to operate their complex devices.

Though proving to be highly effective, they would come back to bite the Livian empire. With the onset of the peace of the 11th Era, branches of the military would slowly dissolve into mercenary corps. The many princes, dukes  and merchant lords would come to find the saboteurs’ expertise invaluable in setting their competition back a few years.

entries.name: Saboteur
entries: The war is not yet over. All that has changed are the front lines.

subclassFeature.name: Saboteur Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Saboteur Spells table. These spells count as Artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Saboteur Spells
rows: {@spell mirror image|phb|mirror image}, {@spell maximillian's earthen grasp|xge|maximillian's earthen grasp}

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with Mason’s Tools and Alchemist’s Tools. If you already have either of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Third Arm
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to magically transform your Mason’s Tools into a contraption that functions as a third arm. Once a day, you can spend an hour to produce your third arm from your Mason’s Tools. Only when this third arm is wielded by you can you utilise the rest of this feature. While wielding it, it can be utilized as a set of Mason’s Tools.

The Hand is a tiny magical object that shares its initiative with you. Additionally you use your actions and its actions in any order. While it is being wielded it can be in your space but cannot move more than 5 feet away from you and has a movement speed of half of the wearer(rounded down).
If the arm is not wielding anything you can use a bonus action to perform the following with it:-

entries.name: Slip Away
entries: The arm aids provides a distraction, allowing you to disengage

entries.name: Protect
entries: The arm readies into a defensive stance reducing damage at some cost to its structural integrity. If you are hit  and take piercing,bludgeoning or slashing damage,you may reduce the damage by 1d8 and instead apply it to the hand.

entries.name: Repair
entries: (2/Day). The hands innate magic restores 2d8 + PB hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Dodge
entries: The arm anticipates any attack made against it. It gains the benefits of a Dodge action.

entries.name: Help
entries: You or another creature within the arm's reach gains the benefit of a help action. When done this way, it does not grant advantage on skill checks.
If a bonus action wasn’t used to activate it and isn’t wielding anything, it will automatically perform the dodge action.

The arm has an AC of 13 + your Proficiency Bonus and a number of hit points equal to four times your artificer level. It is immune to poison damage and psychic damage, and all conditions. If it is forced to make an ability check or a saving throw, treat all its ability scores as 10 (+0). If the mending spell is cast on it, it regains 2d6 hit points. It disappears after 1 hour or if it is reduced to 0 hit points.

You may determine the arms appearance when you create it. It consists of a base that is worn on your body and the appendage which may range in appearance as an arm with many joints, to a tentacle resembling a spine, to a floating claw.

subclassFeature.name: Apprentice Arsonist
entries: At 3rd level, Your knowledge in volatile alchemy has granted you the ability to create Bombs. Using your Alchemist’s Tools you may create a number of them equal to your proficiency bonus during a short or long rest. Creating more than that will result in the oldest bomb turning inert and disintegrating. Bombs that are not on your person begin to decay and will too turn inert and disintegrate after a days time has passed.
While you possess these bombs, you may use an action to throw them upto 20 feet away after which they will explode on impact, affecting creatures in a spherical area.
When you create the bombs you can determine its type from the the following

entries.name: Fireworks
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 15 foot radius to a Dexterity Saving Throw. Deals 3d10 Fire Damage on a failure.

entries.name: Sunburst
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 10 foot radius to a Constitution Saving Throw. Deals 3d8 Radiant Damage and Blinds them on a failure.

entries.name: Impellors
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 20 foot radius to a Strength Saving Throw. Deals 3d8 Thunder Damage and throws them back 10 foot on a failure.

entries.name: Box of Nox
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 10 feet radius to a Constitution Saving Throw. Deals 4d4 Poison Damage and they become poisoned.

entries.name: Canned Fog
entries: Produces the Fog Cloud Spell Effect at the point of impact.

entries.name: Wurmbite
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 20 feet radius to a Dexterity Saving Throw. Deals 4d6 Acid Damage and another 2d6 on the start of its turn on a failure. And half as much on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Instead of one of the attacks, you can throw a bomb.

items: You can cast spells from your Third Arm and while it is not wielding anything, you gain a climbing speed of 15 feet.

When a bomb damages an object that isn’t being worn or carried, depending on the material of the object and the bomb used, it deals critical damage. For dirt and/or stone, an Impeller, For Metal a Wurmbite, For wood a Fireworks.

subclassFeature.name: Explosives Expert
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can increase the potency of your explosives.

items: Your Bombs deal an additional dice of damage of its damage type if it can deal damage.

You gain the ability to plant bombs and explode them remotely. When you use a bomb to interact with an object, you may affix the bomb to it given that it is not being worn or carried.You may then set a timer for when it explodes(Remember that a bomb may become inert after a days time from creation has passed). Or you may activate one of your choice with a bonus action. A bomb that is damaged by another bomb will automatically explode.

subclassFeature.name: Pyrotechnic Pandemonium
entries: Starting at 15th level, Once you breach the enemy’s lines, you turn into the very spirit of chaos.

items: On your first round of combat, you can utilize your arms functions using a free action

Once per short/long rest, You can use a bonus action to throw 3 grenades with your third arm. Creatures affected must also make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries: The result of a failed enchantment. These weapons' blade edge throb with a volatile keenness

entries.name: Age
entries: A Leberi grows to be a teen at around the same age as humans though they age slower afterwards, living to be around 130 years old though some live upto 150 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: A Leberi’s concerns tend to start and end with themselves and those of close relation when in Leberi Society, Staying neutral most of the time. When taken out of their element though, they may align extremely in any direction.

entries.name: Size
entries: Leberi Tend to be a little taller than humans on average and weigh a little less. Your size is Medium

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Pungent Blood
entries: Your blood has the strange property of being thicker. You are resistant to Poison Damage and Immune to Diseases.

entries.name: Natural Escaladers
entries: Your long, warped and rubbery fingers allow for a firmer grip granting you a climbing speed of 15 ft.

entries.name: Sensory Sacrifice
entries: Depending on the circumstance of your birth you may have lost one or more senses to gain a boon granted as an eldritch invocation. This invocation must not have any prerequisites. You may lose Smell and Taste, Sight or Hearing.

entries.name: Language
entries: You speak Liberian and 1 language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Leberi grow into their teens the same time humans do and possess some facet of their Leberi Longevity living to be around 110 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Fiercely argumentative, the Leberi tend to sit anywhere in terms of alignment except on the fence.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half Leberi are aren't too dissimilar from humans in body proportion, though they tend to be more lean. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sour Blood
entries: You have advantage against saving throws involving poison damage and Disease.

entries.name: Seabound
entries: Swimming comes naturally to you. You gain a swim speed of 15 ft.

entries.name: Skilled Artisan
entries: You become proficient in any one skill and either one set of tools or one weapon.

entries.name: Otherworldly Trace
entries: You can attune to 1 additional item as long as one of the items you’re attuned to is a tattoo.

entries.name: Language
entries: Common, Leberi and one other language.

lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Tsochar takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the Tsochar can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:
-The walls of the liar shake mildly. Each creature in the lair must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or fall prone, taking {@dice 1d6} Bludgeoning Damage

-The Tsochar telepathically communicates with any creature with 0 hp within 120 feet of the avatar. That creature sees an indescribably beautiful unfolding pattern of stars and is immediately restored to 1 hp. A creature restored this way is charmed by the Tsochar until the end of its next turn. While charmed by the avatar, that creature must use its action and movementto move up to its speed toward the Tsochar on its turn.

-The Tsochar casts the {@spell command} spell on every creature of his choice in the lair. It needn't see each one, but it must be aware that an individual is in the lair to target that creature. It issues the same command to all the targets.

action.name: Tail Lash

monster.name: Tsochar (Single Worm)

entries: It can sense the general direction of other Tsochar.
trait.name: Community Being

entries: If the Tsochar is in the space of another Tsochar of the same size category, they merge to form a community. When a Tsochar does so, their hitpoints and Dice for abilities are doubled. Their Proficiency bonus also goes up by 1 along with changes in their base stats.
trait.name: Create Bond

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Mausin is an 15th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Masiun has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
entries: When necromancer kills a creature that is neither a construct nor undead with a spell of 1st level or higher, the necromancer regains hit points equal to twice the spell's level, or three times if it is a necromancy spell.

action.name: Devilish Incarnate (1/day)
entries: Mausin projects the manifestation of her pact in the form of an ancient red dragon. The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 18d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d4 + 8}) piercing damage.

{@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
action.name: Life Drain

entries: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.
action.name: Create Specter

languages: The languages it knew in life
monster.name: Amon-Kiir

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

headerEntries: The wraith casts one of the following spells using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks):
spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting

entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
trait.name: Incorporeal Movement

entries: The wraith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
trait.name: Magic Resistance

entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

entries: When the wraith casts a spell and is interrupted by an enemy's {@spell counterspell}, treat the spell's level as 3 levels higher.
trait.name: Spell Penetration

entries: The wraith has advantage on saving throws it makes to maintain its concentration.
trait.name: Supreme Focus

A creature that fails the saving throw is linked to the tsochar. Any consequent saving throw against this ability will be made at disadvantage as long as the target is linked to this tsochar. The Link is broken on a success or when a creature uses its action to make a Wisdom Saving throw to break the link.
When this tsochar is dropped to 0 hitpoints. Every creature linked to it must make a Consitiution saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} psychic damage as the link breaks.

entries: The Tsochar can Dash or hide as bonus action.
trait.name: Cunning Action.

entries: The tsochar can attempt to bore its way into the body of a Small or larger humanoid that is {@condition incapacitated} or has been {@condition grappled} for three consecutive rounds by the tsochar. This process takes 1 minute of concentration during which the target is {@condition incapacitated}. This creature becomes the tsochar's host. The Tsochar can choose to either inhabit or replace.
While inside a host, the tsochar cannot be targeted by attacks or spells.

A {@spell Remove curse},  {@spell Greater Restoration}, {@spell Heal} or {@spell Wish} spell cast on the target will expell the Tsochar. The Tsochar will appear in the space of its host and the host may or may not be alive depending on the type of possession.
trait.name: Wear Flesh

entries: The tsochar leaves its host alive and aware. The tsochar can take no actions while inhabiting a host other than those described here.

At any time as an action, the tsochar can inflict indescribable agony to its host, dealing {@dice 1d8} to {@damage 5d8} damage and incapacitating the host for 1 round. Each week the tsochar inhabits the host, the host's Constitution score decreases by 1. If the host dies for any reason, the tsochar can choose to Replace the host or leave it.
trait.name: Inhabit

entries: The tsochar bores out the host's nervous system, killing it and animating the body as its puppet. The body is effectively dead, and begins to decay at the normal rate. After 1 month, the host in uninhabitable. The host's body has HP equal to half its HP maximum and it can't regain HP.

The tsochar can control the host's body directly and can take any actions of the host of its turn. If the host had spell slots prepared, the tsochar can cast spells as the host, but can't regain spell slots.
trait.name: Replace

entries: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.
action.name: Beak

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the roc can't use its talons on another target.
action.name: Talons

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage the target is {@condition grappled} and pulled 60ft towards the roc in a straight line. If there are any obstacles on the way, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} extra damage for each obstacle.
action.name: Vine Whip

entries: The roc makes a vine attack or a talon attack
legendary.name: Attack

entries: The Roc can pull one {@condition grappled} creature 60 ft towards it and restrain it.
legendary.name: Vine pull (1 Action)

entries: The Roc grounds itself and digs its vines into the ground. Every creature within 60ft of the roc needs to succeed on a dexterity saving throw {@dc 19} or be {@condition grappled}.
legendary.name: Take root (2 Actions)

entries: All Creatures within 60ft of the roc are pulled 10 ft into the ground and are {@condition restrained}.
legendary.name: Meet the earth (3 Actions)

entries: As a reaction when attacked, the roc can use the vines to form a carapace around it. the carapace has 30 hit points and an AC of 20. Melee attacks at it are made with advantage.
reaction.name: Vine Defence

fly.condition: Hover when 20ft close to the ground

entries: Roll a {@dice d100} at the start of your turn. On a 50 or higher, the Roc can end one effect on itself or dispel one effect it can see within 60ft. The tsochari learn from all thier fallen
trait.name: Adaptation

entries: The tsochari roc has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
trait.name: Keen Sight

entries: The Rot Devourer makes three attacks: Two with its claws and one with its tail.
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. A creature that suffers the acid damage must make a constitution saving throw ({@dc 17}). If the creature fails on three consecutive saving throws, the creature is considered diseased. A diseased creature gets a  -3 from all Ability checks, Saving throws and attack rolls.
action.name: Claws

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
action.name: Tail Swipe

entries: You point at a location within range, and a glowing 1-foot-diameter ball of emerald acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 12d4} acid damage and another {@damage 5d4} acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.
action.name: Vitriolic Sphere {@recharge}

entries: The Rot devourer jumps into a fleshy wall and emerges from another one 30 feet away, dealing a claws attack immediately.
legendary.name: Flesh burrowing

entries: The Rot devourer sings a low-frequency song. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. If the target is hurt, it can repeat the saving throw. Target who succeeds in a saving throw is immune to the song for 1 day.
legendary.name: Paralyzing song (costs 2 actions)

entries: The rot devourer can breathe air and water.
trait.name: Amphibious

entries: If the rot devourer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)

entries: When the flesh salamander takes bludgeoning, piercing, slashing or force damage, each creature in melee takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.
trait.name: Acidic Splash

entries: Jiro can make 2 slam attacks and use rock trap if available
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.
action.name: Slam

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) piercing damage. Regardless of a miss or a hit, the creature needs to make a Desterity saving throw {@dc 17} or be net'd, {@condition restrained} and {@condition prone}
action.name: Jade Bolt

entries: jiro targets one creature within 10ft and traps it in an encasing of jade. The creature has full cover from attacks and area of effects that rely on sight. The cage has 50 Hitpoints and has an AC of 18
action.name: Rocktrap {@recharge 6}

entries: During its first turn, the jiro has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the jiro scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.
trait.name: Assassinate

entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the jiro's darkvision.
trait.name: Devil's Sight

entries: The Overseer can make 2 slash attacks or use break defences with 1 attack
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage.
action.name: Sword

entries: The Overseer puts a shield on a pawn on the board for 2 rounds. the shield can be broken with any spell of lvl 2 or higher or the  dispel special action.
action.name: Sicilian Defence

entries: the overseer protects himself in a force shield for 2 rounds. the Shield can be removed with a spell of 4th level of higher.
action.name: Scandanavian Defence

entries: The overseer opens its cavity and allows the king to make an attack
action.name: Kings Gambit {@recharge 5}

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 7d8 + 5}) piercing damage.
action.name: King's Gambit attack

entries: The overseer subjects one creature to mindshattering pain. The creature must make a {@dc 19} constitution saving throw or lose 10 AC till the end of the overseer's next round
action.name: Break Defences

headerEntries: The Overseer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19} and {@hit 11} to hit). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting

entries: If a pawn reaches the end of the board, it becomes one size larger and can use its action to self destruct. It  explodes in a 20ft radius and deals  {@damage 8d8} Fire damage on a Dexterity save of {@dc 15}
trait.name: Pawn Upgrade self destruct

entries: Pawns have a move speed of 20ft and if it enters an unclaimed tile, it claims it.
trait.name: Pawn travel

entries: A claimed tile will extend spikes at Initiative count 20 dealing {@dice 12d10} on a failed Dexterity saving throw or half as much on a successful one. Pushing the creature to the nearest tile.
Additionally, it deals {@damage 3d8} fire damage at  the start of a creature's turn
trait.name: Spike Floor
Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ostinato can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The ostinato is {@condition invisible} as per a greater invisibility spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ostinato has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ostinato makes two cacophony ray attacks.

action.name: Cacophony Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Aural Symbiosis (1/Day)
entries: One humanoid that the ostinato can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or the ostinato merges with it, becoming an enjoyable, repetitive tune in its host's mind. The ostinato can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. The target retains control of its body and is aware of the ostinato's presence only as a melody, not as a living entity. The target no longer needs to eat or drink, gains the ostinato's Magic Resistance trait, and has advantage on Charisma checks. It also has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and it can't maintain concentration on spells or other effects for more than a single turn. The target can make a {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check once every 24 hours; on a success, it realizes that the music it hears comes from an external entity.

The Aural Symbiosis lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the ostinato ends it as a bonus action, or the ostinato is forced out by a dispel evil and good spell or comparable magic. When the Aural Symbiosis ends, the ostinato bursts forth in a thunderous explosion of sound and reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target. All creatures within 60 feet, including the original target, take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. The target becomes immune to this ostinato's Aural Symbiosis for 24 hours if it succeeds on the saving throw or after the Aural Symbiosis ends.

action.name: Voracious Aura (1/Day)
entries: While merged with a humanoid (see Aural Symbiosis), the ostinato feeds on nearby creatures. Up to nine creatures of the ostinato's choice within 60 feet of it can be targeted. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and have its hit point maximum reduced by the same amount until it finishes a long rest. The target dies if its maximum hit points are reduced to 0. Victims notice this damage immediately, but not its source.

weapon.name: Arcane Cannon
weapon.crew: 3x Lvl 1-7 spellcasters or 1x lvl 8+ spell caster
entries: It takes 1 action to choose the firing mode, 1 action to aim it, and 1 action to fire it. If the user is a spellcaster of level 8 or highter, then they may do all these three on one action. When the airship is started, this arcane cannon whirls to life with 20 charges. Each use of the arcane cannon consumes a portion of this charge based on the firing mode.
The Arcane Cannon's effects have a saving DC of 19 and a +11 to hit on attacks.

action.name: Firing Mode : Chain Lightning (6 Charges)
entries: You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within 150ft. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.
A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 10d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Firing Mode : Chain Enervation (7 Charges)
entries: You fire a bolt of negative energy at one creature you can see within 200ft. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the bolt does {@damage 12d6} necrotic damage and the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw or gain two levels of {@condition exhaustion}. The bolt then leaps to another target within 50 feet of the previous target that hasn't already been targeted by the spell; if more than one is available, you may choose which target to attack. The effect continues attacking creatures one after another in a chain until it misses or there are no more creatures eligible to be hit.

action.name: Firing Mode : Circle of Death (6 Charges)
entries: A sphere of negative energy ripples out in a 60-foot-radius sphere from a point within 150 feet range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Firing Mode : Cloak bubble (4 Charges)
entries: The entire ship becomes {@condition invisible} until the spell ends (1 hour). Anything the ship is carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on the ship.

action.name: Firing Mode : Deadline (5 Charges)
entries: You fire a 1-inch-wide, 60-foot-long beam of senescent energy that pierces through creatures, objects, and structures alike at untraceable speed. An object or structure pierced by the beam has its AC permanently reduced by 4 if it is inorganic. If it is organic, the point pierced by the beam and the object or structure's material within 1 foot of the beam decays and ages until it is brittle enough to break by a light touch.

A creature pierced by the beam must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage and instantly ages {@dice 2d4 x 10} years on a failed save; if this damage would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, it falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable instead of dying, and it ages an additional year for each point of damage it took in excess of its current hit points. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't aged.

The aging can be reversed with the greater restoration spell or more powerful magic, but only if it is cast within 24 hours of failing the saving throw. After that time, only a wish spell can reverse the effect.
